title: Canot on transatlantic slave trade - causation

content.question: Events such as the one described in the excerpt most directly contributed to which of the following developments?

choices.label: Some Atlantic creoles found opportunities for social mobility in the Americas after the Middle Passage.
Activists used depictions of the dehumanizing conditions onboard slave ships to promote antislavery sentiment.
Monetary incentives for African kingdoms to engage in warfare decreased because of the dangers of slave trading.
The publication of slave narratives declined as many white Americans became less sympathetic to the stories of formerly enslaved people.

content.answer: Activists used depictions of the dehumanizing conditions onboard slave ships to promote antislavery sentiment.

topic.text: 2.4: African Resistance on Slave Ships and the Antislavery Movement
